sections.title: What is a Trajectory?
sections.content:
A trajectory is a planned path that your robot will follow during autonomous. Road Runner lets you define these paths with high precision, including straight lines, curves, and complex chains of movement.

More info: Road Runner Docs: Trajectories

sections.title: Building a Simple Trajectory
Chaining Trajectories and Using Splines
sections.content:
You can chain multiple trajectories together for complex routines. Splines allow for smooth, curved paths.

sections.title: Chaining and Splines Example
Best Practices for Trajectory Design
sections.content:
- Break up your autonomous into small, reusable methods.
- Avoid writing all code in a single large file.
- Test each trajectory separately before combining.

Best practices: gm0: Trajectory Best Practices

sections.title: Practice: Create and Chain Trajectories
sections.description: Write code to build two trajectories: one that moves forward 24 inches, then another that turns 90 degrees and moves forward 12 inches. Chain them together and follow both.
